tool.name: MappingQC

param.name: samfile
param.label: Choose the sam file on which you want to do quality control

param.name: treated
param.label: Are you doing mapping quality control on the untreated or the treated sam file?

param.name: cores
param.label: Enter the number of cores to run the mapping quality control

param.name: sqlite_db
param.label: SQLite DB with RIBO-seq data after mapping
param.help: The SQLite results dDB should at least contain output from the RIBO-seq mapping

param.name: ensembl_db
param.label: Select the correct ensembl annotation DB, should be in line with the Ensembl version given in the mapping
param.help: The Ensembl sqlite databases are species and annotation version specific. If your genome of interest is not listed - contact administrator.

param.name: plotrpftool
param.label: Choose the style of the RPF phase plot
param.option: 3D bar chart (may suffer from Escher effects)

param.name: offset
param.label: The way P-site offsets were determined
param.option: Offsets from plastid in mapping process

param.name: offsetFile
param.label: Choose a text file with the offsets. Each line should be structured as RPF length - offset, seperated by a tab or a space

param.name: offset_img
param.label: Choose the p site offset image from plastid

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
MappingQC is a tool to easily generate some figures which give a nice overview of the quality of the mapping of ribosome profiling data. More specific, it gives an overview of the P site offset calculation, the gene distribution and the metagenic classification. Furthermore, MappingQC does a thorough analysis of the triplet periodicity and the linked triplet phase (typical for ribosome profiling) in the canonical transcript of your data. Especially, the link between the phase distribution and the RPF length, the relative sequence position and the triplet identity are taken into account. MappingQC is also available as a stand-alone tool, separated from PROTEOFORMER and its SQLite results structure, so that you can apply it on every samfile you like, independent of the mapping source.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
1) SAM file with mapping results
2) Results DB out of PROTEOFORMER mapping step
3) Ensembl DB with annotation for the same Ensembl version and species as in your PROTEOFORMER mapping step
------
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
1) HTML file: overview file of the tables and figures. Main output of MappingQC
2) ZIP file: contains a folder with all necessary figures. In this folder you can also find the overview HTML file.
------
.. class:: infomark
**Citation**
For the underlying tool and its use in Galaxy, cite: ::
Verbruggen, Steven and Menschaert, Gerben. 2017. "MappingQC: a tool for quality control of ribosome profiling mapping results". Unpublished.
